oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christmas dinner at Fannie Battle Day Home attended by some civic-minded student representatives of Central High School, circa 1950 December 18
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph showing some of the high school attendees at the 1950 Christmas dinner held at the Fannie Battle Day Home. The dinner was "given in honor of the tiny tots at the Fannie Battle Day Home by members of the Fannie Battle Social Workers who maintain this institution at 311 South Fourth Street for the benefit of working mothers with children. Pictured in the photograph are some students at Central High School who have furnished the turkeys served at the annual holiday affair for the past 20 years, and some officials at the home board and their husbands. Left to right they are William Baucom, Miss Stella Jennette and Miss Annie Mai Alred, all Central students, James V. Blevins, Mrs. Blevins, president of the social workers, Mrs. Frank Drowota, president-elect, and Dr. Drowota." This photograph illustrated the newspaper article "Children feted at party at Day Home," published in the 18 December 1950 issue of the Nashville Banner. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Baucom, William; Jennette, Stella; Alred, Annie Mai; Blevins, James V.; Blevins, James V., Mrs.; Drowota, Vivien; Drowota, Frank F., 1904-1998
